text.value: The official title of a protocol used to identify a clinical study.Include phase (e.g. pilot proof of concept study, phase I, phase II, etc.), design (e.g. randomized, double blind, placebo controlled, etc.), if the study is multi-center, the investigational agent (drug, device, biologic, vaccine, procedural and/or behavioral etc., and target disease(s)
A short study title written in language intended for the lay public.
The Protocol Number assigned by the sIRB
Select the study type, either Interventional (Clinical Trial) or Observational (Non-Interventional)
Select the organization's type of involvement in the study
Sponsor or Funding Source Protocol Number, if applicable
Unique Protocol Identification Number used by the sponsor, if applicable
Physical address of the sIRB (Reviewing Institution)
Overall Principal Investigator for the Study
The first or given name associated with the overall principal investigator
Last name, surname or family name associated with the overall principal investigator
Suffix such as Junior (Jr.), Senior (Sr.), I, II, III, IV, etc. associated with the overall principal investigator's name
Academic and Professional Degrees associated with the Overall Principal Investigator
Academic and Professional degrees associated with the overall principal investigator
The institution of the overall principal investigator
The department name or division for the overall principal investigator
Physical address of the overall principal investigator
Phone number, including area code for the overall principal investigator
Email address associated with overall principal investigator
Confirmed or Potential Relying Site Overview
Name of Institution for which their IRB agrees to rely on the decisions of the reviewing IRB at their own institutions.
Phone number, including area code for the relying institution
Is a Federal Wide Assurance (FWA) Number assigned?

DHHS assigned number indicating Assurance of Compliance with the Office of Human Research Protections. The only type of assurance of compliance accepted and approved by OHRP for institutions engaged in non-exempt human subjects research conducted or supported by HHS. Under a FWA, an institution commits to HHS that it will comply with the requirements set forth in 45 CFR 46, as well as the terms of assurance.
DHHS assigned number indicating Assurance of Compliance with the Office of Human Research Protections. Enter just the numeric value of the FWA.
Institutions for which their IRB agrees to rely on the decisions of the reviewing IRB at their own institutions.
Site Principal Investigator at Relying Site
Relying Site Principal Investigator First Name
First Name or Given Name of PI at a site conducting the study, responsible for the conduct of the study at his/her relying institution
Relying Site Principal Investigator Last Name
Last name, surname or family name of PI at a site conducting the study, responsible for the conduct of the study at his/her relying institution
Suffix such as Junior (Jr.), Senior (Sr.), I, II, III, IV, etc. associated with the relying site principal investigator
Academic and Professional Degrees associated with the Relying Site Principal Investigator
Academic and Professional degrees associated with the relying site principal investigator
Phone number, including area code for the relying site principal investigator
Email address associated with the relying site principal investigator
Address of Relying Site Principal Investigator
Administrative Use Only (will be hidden in the future)
Questionnaire Response ID for the parent Questionnaire Response (such as the Initiate a Study Questionnaire Response), if any
ID of the Research Study FHIR Resource associated with the study Questionnaire Responses
Questionnaire Response ID of the local considerations Questionnaire Response, if any
